fields.description:
In versions prior to 2.2 there was a trio of buttons in the top left section of the window that are used to switch between the Log, Status, and Search views.  These buttons have been removed and are now only available from the menu bar.  Please add them as options to the toolbar.
Ironically, the Windows update has made them giant, space eating, tabs at the bottom of the main window.  Those tabs should be removed and again, I should have the option to put them into the toolbar.
fields.summary: View buttons missing

fields.description: SourceTree app cannot remember password to BitBucket account and doesn't use Keychain for it.
fields.summary: Keychain password is not remembered

fields.description:
When I first upgrade to 2.2.1, the toolbar is messed up. After a further upgrade to 2.2.2, the Git Flow button is also missing. I had to manually add it back. 

Also, preferences such as repositories that are automatically opened during startup is no longer valid.
fields.summary: Git Flow button missing from toolbar after upgrading to 2.2.x

fields.description: For users who mainly use shortcuts, it would be nice to be able to hide top menu to have more space available.
fields.summary: Add option to hide top menu

fields.description:
I'm using Kaleidoscope as my external merge/diff tool, but when i try to launch it via the right click menu on a conflicting file, it doesn't start (nor is the file automatically resolved) 

This used to work in 2.1
fields.summary: On conflict, launch external tool doesn't appear to work

fields.description:
Pre 2.2 you were able to push a tag to your remote branch.  However, when performing the same steps in 2.2.x, the tag is never actually pushed.

To reproduce:
1. Create a tag in the repo.
2. In the side menu, scroll to the tag, right click to open the menu for the tag.
3. Select Push to Origin

Expected
- tag should push to origin

Actual
- nothing happens
fields.summary: Cannot push GIT tag to remote

fields.description: If I try to create HG Flow in a fresh Repo, it doesn't work! My workmate have the same problem. I created a small video to show the behaviour:
fields.summary: Create HG Flow is not possible

fields.description:
I have a single local repository in SourceTree. Right-click on it to bring up context menu, select delete. On "Confirm Remove?" dialog I select "Also Move To Trash". On "Confirm Delete Repository" dialog I select "Ok". Repository still exists, no indications of any attempted delete or errors.

This occured after program update from 2.1 to 2.2 (~20 mins ago). I also quit & restarted twice, each time the same actions/result. Local repository has my permissions.
fields.summary: Will not delete repository

fields.description:
I have a Bash alias `st=open -a SourceTree .` to quickly open the active directory in SourceTree. Today I updated to 2.2 (from 2.0) and noticed that this is no longer working – it brings SourceTree to the front but does not open the repository at the given path.

Please bring this back, I use the shortcut all the time.
fields.summary: `open -a SourceTree .` does no longer work

fields.description: After setting the filter popup on top of the Log View to "Current Branch" (for example) and clicking on another branch in the sidebar, the popup resets to "All Branches". I would like the selection to stick, even across app restarts.
fields.summary: ER: Log View filter popup selection should stick and be persisted

fields.description:
I "upgraded" from an actual functioning instance of SourceTree to this...not actually "functioning," per se version.

I had a few auto-entered URIs to my local origin server.

I wanted to prune them a bit.

So, I select Preferences->Network, and get a list of URIs.

I select one one, and select "Remove". I get the "Are You Sure?" dialog.

Yup. I'm sure.

The $#@!!! thing is still there. It won't die. The Living Dead. BRRRAAAAINNNSSS...
fields.summary: Cannot Remove Default URLs

fields.description:
In the new GUI, there is no longer a way to push releases. You now have to use keyboard shortcuts. 

This is a decrease in usability for new users. 

Sourcetree should add back the following to the top bar: 

- Tag a commit 
- Use git flow to finalize a release.
fields.summary: No git tag button anymore.

fields.description: Since upgrading to the latest version of sourcetree Version 2.2 (46), I'm getting a pop up every few seconds that a git branch doesn't exist
fields.summary: regression - bad revision

fields.description: Hi.  Thanks for writing SourceTree; overall it's a great git client.  Unfortunately, the new Toolbar icons in SourceTree v2.2 are very small and have removed all use of color, so they are much more difficult to see/read/use than those in previous versions.  Please make better icons (larger ones with use of color) available for the toolbar.  In the meantime, I will be sticking with v2.0.5.2 until better icons are made available.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Please bring back better icons!

fields.description:
The new UI on the left makes it harder to distinguish between items under a heading and headings themselves; the hierarchy is confusing at a glance.

Possible solutions are to reduce vertical whitespace between branches, stashes, etc., or to indent them differently from the heading text. Currently the large vertical whitespace plus the fact that the heading text is on the same left coordinate as the subject text is hard to read.
fields.summary: Left UI nav does not have clear visual hierarchy

fields.description: Pretty much every time I switch from my dev branch to master, pull from master, and switch back to my dev branch SourceTree just seems to hang and always need to force quit it.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs after merging from master to dev branch

fields.description: It would be nice if you can add a checkout button to be added in the toolbar as it was in the previous version.
fields.summary: Checkout shortcut for the toolbar

fields.description: In v2.2 version; navigate tree trim the long branch name with '...';
fields.summary: Sourcetree_v2.2_NavigateTree_branches_name_trimmed

fields.description:
Need the following language packs updated for ST 2.2 and later:
Chinese
French
German
Japanese
Portuguese
Russian
Spanish
Spanish (Latin)

*CURRENT WORKAROUND:*
Downgrade to 2.1.
fields.summary: Need language packs updated.  Currently not usable in ST 2.2 or later.

fields.description: When pressing the button "Terminal", iTerm2 is lauched, but it's launched in the background behind the SourceTree application window so the user doesn't know that it actually has been launched.
fields.summary: Launching iTerm2 does so in the background

fields.description: When selecting the menu option to install command line tools the application crashes. I've attached the contents of the OS X error reporting window that appears when crashing.
fields.summary: Fails to install command line tools

fields.description:
When launching the application (v2.2+) the splash screen is displayed, but with an empty "Atlassian Customer Agreement", the continue-button is grayed out so it's impossible to continue.

I've attached a screen shot & the preferences file, in case that is corrupt in some way.

I did try to re-install the 2.1.x version and it's working fine.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Unable to launch v2.2.2
Visual bug

fields.description:
I agreed to the customer agreement and I already have an Atlassian account. I click to use my existing account but get a blank field. There are clickable areas inside the field, as the mouse cursor changes in various places. I'm unable to continue, though, as I can't see the form to fill in my credentials.

I've attached two screen shots to show what it looks like.
fields.summary: Stuck at login after "upgrade" to 2.2 from 2.1

fields.description:
When I select the "Uncommitted changes" row in the history pane, and start to preview the file changes in the main view or the commit view, the interface randomly jumps back to the main view and highlights the most recent commit in the history pane.

If I were to do manually what the interface is doing automatically, it would be as if I [clicked Cancel in the commit view, then] clicked the most recent commit in the history pane.

I basically have to keep highlighting the "Uncommitted changes" row until the UI stops jumping back.

This issue seems to have come along since the interface has received its new look. (I'm not sure if that affects 2.0 or 2.1, but I've for sure noticed this with 2.2.)
fields.summary: Trying to view/commit "Uncommitted changes" interface jumps to latest commit

fields.description:
The application stays in an unresponsive state after pressing Return in the Merge Progress Dialog:
1. start a merge by right clicking on a branch tag
2. confirm to do the merge
=> the merge progress dialog (log output enabled) shows up with the single "close" button
3. quickly press return (it is unclear whether the return has to happen before the merge has finished or not, but it seems this does not matter as this issue happens 95%)
=> the application freezes in the following way:
- the modal dialog stays open and receives input (pressing return again makes it flash)
- since the dialog is modal, you cannot do anything else and have to force close using Alt-Cmd-Escape.

When you confirm the close dialog using the mouse instead of pressing return, the issue does not occur.

Since I'm a keyboard power use as most developers this issue is really annoying.
fields.summary: Attempt close the modal dialog after merging a branch leaves application in unresponsive state

fields.description:
Open a repo
Open the Commit view
Add an unstaged file
Observe the view changes back to main view
fields.summary: Main view pane resets to commit history pane

fields.description:
I am missing the GIT Flow button in the UI.

GIT Flow is a major part of my work flow and I wonder how it happened you forgot this. Or did I miss something?

 !image-2016-02-22-13-32-22-130.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Missing GIT Flow button

fields.description: After installing from SourceTree_2.1.dmg and updating to 2.2 I am stuck on Atlassian Customer Agreement stage.
fields.summary: Stuck on Customer Agreement stage

fields.description:
When checking unstaged files to make them staged using spacebar on keyboard, focus will jump to the sidebar (selecting "file status") making the user unable to continue staging files with spacebar like it was possible in the previous versions.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Select "File Status" from "Workspace" in the left sidebar
2. In the "Unstaged files" middle pane, select the first file
3. Press "space" to stage the file
4. File becomes staged

=> 5. Notice the focus has jumped onto the sidebar again and the user is no longer able to continue staging other files with keyboard. You have to use the mouse to select the unstaged file again and repeat this very annoying process all the time.
fields.summary: Focus jumps from unstaged files to the sidebar

fields.description:
SourceTree leaves a requester open when I create a new local repo and choose to also create it remotely. The requester remains open, the "Cancel" button does not work. The remote repository gets created, already open repositories remain usable but the repo browser is unusable. Application can not be quit with Command+Q command or menu.

 !image-2016-02-22-10-52-32-595.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating new remote repository leaves requester open, renders repo browser unusable

fields.description:
Hi,
The Git-Flow button, which we are using very often, disappeared from toolbar after last update. We can also use it by clicking CMD+OPTION+F, but the button was more comfortable for our newbie developers.

Regards,
fields.summary: Git Flow button disappeared from toolbar

fields.description: Please put the git flow icons back
fields.summary: Git Flow icons

fields.description:
This occurs on the recent Major release "Version 2.2 (46)" which isn't available in the "affects versions" dropdown.  (that in itself is another bug)

This version breaks the "Reset Development to this commit".  I used to use this feature often, and since it no longer works after upgrading to 2.2, I have reverted back to 2.1. 

Reproduction Steps:
* Open any repo with multiple commits 
* View the repo history
* Right click on a previous commit (something other than the most recent) and choose the  "Reset Development to this commit" option in the right click menu
* A dialog box "are you sure you want to move the branch pointer" displays, and requires you to specify a mode.
* Select the "Hard Mode" & Click "OK"
* A new dialog box displays "Warning: destructive operation"
* clicking "OK" on this "warning" dialog simply returns you to the previous dialog box *without performing the operation*  (it's as if the "OK" button has the same function as the "Cancel" button.)
* Thus, there is no way to use the SourceTree to "reset to a previous commit"

It's nice that you have cleaner up the UI in SourceTree - but breaking a key GIT feature while doing it is un-excusable.
fields.summary: Version 2.2 (46) breaks the "hard" option for "Reset Development to this commit"

fields.description:
It is one thing to put out a version for a normal user, but 100% of your users are DEVELOPERS.

Be very careful about the versions you put out.
Version 2.2(46) has more bugs than I ever saw in one place.

*+One cannot make a normal commit.+*
expected - standing on uncommited changes, adding to stage , putting commit message, clicking commit

actual - standing on uncommited changes, window changes on occassion
sometimes i actually get to put files on stage, then window changes on occassion, sometimes it goes back to the last made commit sometimes it opens just another window on top, committing a message is a challenge.

*+One cannot open a window normally.+*
expected - when you right click on the source tree icon, a list opens, clicking on an item of the list even if it is open, its window comes to front.

actual - nothing happens.

*+All the icons are gone - you can hardly notice them anymore+*
expected - want to click add , remove , reset, merge, tag branch
actual - cannot find the buttons to do it
command line is easier
fields.summary: Downgraded to version 2.1

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Clone a github repository with https url
# Delete a remote branch from the sidebar (Right click->Delete...->OK)
# Sourcetree asks for username and password for github
# Click cancel

h3. Result:
The branch is not visible anymore in the remote view, but still exists in the remote repository on github. (Doing a fetch shows it again)

h3. Expected:
The branch is still visible in the remote view, as the deletion was canceled.
fields.summary: Canceling remote branch deletion still shows branch as deleted

fields.description: after update I had to create/login to accounts (which is WAY too much work and confusion since the Bitbucket account did not seem to work so I had to create an Atlassian account) anyhow. I had to stop the process in the middle because of internet issues and not it is stuck on this with no resolution - see img.
fields.summary: stuck on atlassian customer agreement during update to 2.2

fields.description:
I frequently use the up/down arrow keys to flip through the files in "staged files" and "unstaged files".

I am reporting a bug where after sourceTree does some background updating of the remote repo, it steals the tab focus and puts it in the column on the left, usually in "file status" under "workspace".

This is a new and undesirable behavior that didn't crop up for me prior to version 2.2

 !image-2016-02-19-16-38-40-551.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: tab column loses focus

fields.description: In the 2.2 sourcetree, the column for displaying the branch names is apparently not resizeable. This is a pretty serious usability problem as I can't necessarily differentiate between the branches. See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: branch names are cut off and column not resizeable

fields.description:
When merging one branch into another locally, SourceTree UI becomes unresponsive and nothing can be selected.

Steps to reproduce:
# Check out 2 local branches
# Right click one branch and merge into the other branch
# The changes are merged but UI is unresponsive so you cannot push or do any other action

Workaround
# Force quit SourceTree
# Open SourceTree
# The changes will be there and you can take action
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs when right-click merging locally

fields.description:
SourceTree can no longer hard reset via the reset action. When resetting using mixed or soft, there are no problems. 

See the screencast [here|http://recordit.co/VhpA09iV7s].
fields.summary: Reset > Hard > does not do anything
Setting BeyondCompare as mergetool results in empty command line in git config

fields.description:
After upgrading to SourceTree 2.2, I now have a strange behavior.

After right-clicking on a branch and choosing "Merge {branch1} into {branch2}", the merge goes through, but the SourceTree UI then completely locks up. Clicking anywhere causes Mac OSX to beep as if the entire UI is locked/disabled. I cannot quit the app, or close any windows and the only way to recover is to Force Quit.

This happens consistently 100% of the time I use that feature. Attached is a video showing the behaviour. It's a bit hard to tell, but after I confirm the merge dialog, I'm clicking around anywhere in the UI and nothing is working anymore.
fields.summary: SourceTree Mac 2.2 locks up after merging one branch into another

fields.description:
What I've found is that if one of the files is very large then SourceTree become unmanageably slow. For example we use SCSS to compile a css file that is currently 436kb in size. Whenever changes are made to this file, SourceTree becomes too slow to use.
I think it's because it's trying to parse the entire file for changes each time. So it would be really handy if one could tell it not to show changes for a particular file and have it remember that setting.
fields.summary: Unworkably slow Beach Ball on large files.

fields.description:
When viewing a storyboard (iOS interface builder file, xml) of 900 kB, the scrolling is very slow (talking about seconds until the view jumps to the next frame) and trying to stage individual hunks is unusable, don't even try staging lines.

This is not blocking, but quite important.
fields.summary: Viewing changes in large files & staging individual hunks unusable

fields.description:
After every auto-refresh the current view is dropped, all filters or currently active view (ex. Editing current commit comment).
This type of behavior is annoying.
fields.summary: Auto-refresh annoying

fields.description: Would be nice to have an option to set a default remote repo to push too. Example is I have a forked project but keep original remote repo so I can pull and merge back occasionally but would like to push to my remote fork repo. However overtime I push the default is set to original, I have tried manually altering the config encase it was just by sort order in file. I've attached a screenshot to show the example too.
fields.summary: Option to set a default for the push repo

fields.description:
Downloaded the new version of sourceTree.
After installed the app ask me to create and Atlassian account or log in with an existing account.

The problem is when the popup for the log in is opened is *white*, and in the bottom right I have the button Cancel. 
If I go with the mouse over the white pop up, I can see the cursor changing in insert text or pointer (like press button/link).

I logged in because I click on the first field (design pattern teach is a username), insert my username, click TAB, go to the second field, insert my password, and press Enter.

Sorry I don't have the screenshot
fields.summary: Don't show login fields after installed the app
Branch/Remote names are cut off after 20 characters

fields.description:
When choosing SSH instead of HTTPS for the protocol for a bitbucket account, after clicking OK, the account is still on HTTPS - it never accepts the change.

Happens on Windows 1.8.1.0 and Mac 2.2
fields.summary: SSH protocol for bitbucket cloud account never saves

fields.description: When trying to add a custom action in the Custom Action tab of the preferences dialog, the OK and Cancel buttons never clear the pop-down away so the preferences dialog is stuck modal and the app has to be force-exited
fields.summary: OK and Cancel buttons don't work on the Add Custom Action dialog

fields.description:
Empty Area when you resize left panel so:
- Long branch name are not visible
- Empty space not used
- (See Screenshot in attachment)
fields.summary: Branch name too short

fields.description:
After the pull. The parent hash points to ToT. But the graph points to completely different parent. 

Similarly, after a hard-reseting a branch which is lagged from master to a more recent point in the master branch (but not ToT). The git tree graph no longer preserves the parent-child relationship of the submission

In the attached picture. You can see the high-lighted submission's parent is 0bc15cd170 (which is the top of the blue branch). But this is not reflected in the graph.

I want to add that by clicking the link in the submission text, it in fact jump to the right parent. So its only the tree graph is not right.
fields.summary: After pull from ToT with FF merge a change. Branch graph is messed up.

fields.description: After finishing merge to branch, entire SourceTree window becomes unclickable.
fields.summary: After merge, cannot click anywhere in window

fields.description: This seems new after the UI change. I can expand the left panel - yet the branch names are unnecessarily truncated.
fields.summary: Branch names truncated

fields.description:
I have edited multiple files in my repository.  Since the updated version of sourcetree, it constantly refreshes the window landing on the last commit that has been made - moving the view away from uncommitted changes.  I'm trying to stage multiple files and review them, but after ticking a single file for commit it automatically refreshes (despite no changes to the file system) and changes the view to the last commit that was made.  Even if I don't tick anything, it refreshes with about 15s.

This is making it impossible to work with.
fields.summary: Constant Auto Refresh Stop commiting

fields.description:
After merging a branch in to the current branch (i.e. dev into master), the app becomes un-responsive. Clicking anywhere produces no results and the "You can't click here" sound is played.

Hitting CMD+W/Q also does nothing, one has to force quit the app.
fields.summary: App Becomes Unresponsive

fields.description:
I can't reset branched to a commit since the last update.
Tested many repos, same result.
fields.summary: Reset branch to commit using mode "hard" has no effect

fields.description: I am in log view, with the selection on uncommitted changes.  I go an edit some files and when I return to SourceTree the commit selection jumps to the last commit in the log. If I again select another commit, like "uncommitted changes" it will jump back to the last commit.  It does this flickering, re-select behavior a couple of times on entry to the app.
fields.summary: Log View jumps to last commit on file update

fields.description: So I go on a trip without internet, and half-way through source tree stops working, and demands that I login online and agree to some service agreement or whatever. I had it all nicely setup so I can work offline and you broke it. What were you thinking, really? I'm quite angry right now.
fields.summary: Unable to launch the app

fields.description:
Background updates within SourceTree seem to make the commit message window lose keyboard focus while typing.

To Repro:
# Stage a file
# Start typing a commit message while a branch updates its status
# Notice keyboard focus is lost
fields.summary: Commit message window loses keyboard focus while typing

fields.description:
Great product. I have used it for about a year now. As a git newbie it makes my life much easier

I just upgraded my version of source tree. In older version it was really easy to find file I had modified. (I typically have many files that can not be ignored or tracked). In the new version the icon colors change. The colors are very close and hard for visually impaired people to see. 

I recently had similar problem when I upgrade chrome they chose the same color for marking visted and unvisted links. Chrome provides a way to set the color to use for vistied links

see attached image
fields.summary: very hard to find modified files becuase icon color is to close to color used for untracked files

fields.description:
We have lots of tags. The scroll-list based "Jump to" is not useable.

It should be a search (ideally with delayed hint for matched branch, tags and hash)
fields.summary: "Jump to" under branch browser should be a search (ideally with pop-up hint)

fields.description:
When completing the new registration form in 2.2 I am forced to log in to my atlassian(?) account. For this a window with a web form asking for my credentials pops up. 

But this window goes all blank. I don't know why, the underlying elements are there, because the cursor changes when I hover over them, but all I see is white empty window (the contents of the web element, the modal popup panel does have a cancel button).

This seems more like a bug with webkit than sourcetree, but this completely prevents me from completing the installation which is very frustrating.

I have tried multiple times to restart the app, quit all other web browsers, but this issue seems to be independent of all of this.

What is curious is that from time to time (maybe once in 5 runs) it actually worked and I was able to complete the registration by logging in using my google account.
fields.summary: Sourcetree forced registration after update

fields.description: Create patch (patch.diff) from workspace dose not overwrite the exiting one after user agrees to the overwrite.
fields.summary: Create patch (patch.diff) from workspace dose not overwrite the exiting one after user agrees to the overwrite.

fields.description:
They were better than current gray line blind icons.

Main problems with new icons:
1. No color differentiation which makes it hard to find needed button in window.
2. All icons is essentially grey lines, which makes it even harder to differentiate between them (and between them and background).
fields.summary: Please return old SourceTree icons.

fields.description:
I cannot see the full branch or stash names when I increase the left sidebar's width.

I tried to restart Sourcetree to no avail.
fields.summary: Git branch/stash names are truncated to a fixed length regardless of the sidebar width

fields.description: After merging a branch into another, the entire application locks up.  I can't do anything after that.  I have to force quit the app and restart it.
fields.summary: Application locks up after a merge

fields.description:
The app has frozen every time I have tried merging branches.  
OS X El Capitan 10.11.3
fields.summary: App freezes on merge (ver 2.2)

fields.description: versio 2.2 The OK button does not work. No way to hard reset a branch in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Reset branch to - Hard mode - OK button is not working

fields.description:
I see this manifest in 2 ways:
- While one the File Status view, inspecting and staging files for commit, the UI will blit to the Log View. This does not appear to be tied to any particular user action.
- While on the Log View, if you configure the view to a particular branch (from the top of the list, or the side bar) the log view will blit and lose it's current location in the list.

This is making SourceTree effectively unusable.
fields.summary: UI sporadically loses context and reverts to Log View

fields.description: The popup buttons above the main table do not have corresponding menu items. It would be useful to be able to assign keyboard shortcuts for these actions, or use ⇧⌘? to search for menu items by type selection, including branch names.
fields.summary: Add menu items for popup buttons above main table

fields.description: Color for icons for new and modified files are pretty the same (purple and blue). Please restore the original yellow icon for modified files. Thanks.
fields.summary: Restore original yellow icon for modified files

fields.description:
This one is weird - as it shows an issue with basic git functionality, so hard to imagine this to be a SourceTree issue, at the same time sometimes in the recent versions of SourceTree for mac (I think introduced with 2.1) - detecting changes is slow/unreliable.

Could be also a system issue on my side - though there was not much changing on this computer.... there was a change to Sophos Anti-Virus (any known conflicts with that?).

Steps to reproduce:
1) Clone repo
2) Run SourceTree and click on "Uncommitted changes", keep watching the "Unstaged files" list
3) In your IDE (I use Eclipse) - modify some files, save changes

Expected behavior:
Changes detected in SourceTree and modified files show up in the "Unstaged files" list

Actual:
It either takes long to detect the changes (much longer than with previous versions of SourceTree) or they won't show up at all. I have to click around and go back to "Uncommitted changes" to see them.
fields.summary: Slow to detect file changes

fields.description:
The new file icon coloring / scheme is not as clear as the previously used one. 

Previously - it was very easy to find changes in the Unstaged files list.
With the new UI look - the "?" icon is not that much different from the "M" icon (similar colours).
fields.summary: New icon scheme misleading

fields.description: It would be very handy to be able to manage string translations for iOS and Android apps by integrating with OneSky's API.
fields.summary: Integration with OneSky

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. click 'pull' icon from the toolbar
2. click 'ok' button from the popup

expected result: incoming changes are pulled, popup window closes
actual result: incoming changes are pulled, popup window remains open indefinitely

additional details: the only way I have identified to get out of this is to quit and relaunch the application. Hitting 'cancel' from the progress bar closes it, but not the popup itself, and the popup cannot be closed by clicking ok or cancel. Upon relaunching, the new changesets appear in the history as one would expect.

I have only tested this for hg.
fields.summary: hg pull hangs

fields.description:
A persistent and frequent complaint is that I so often get failed operations in SourceTree because of the famous .git/index.lock permission denied message. Obviously, this can't be avoided if I'm doing something with a working copy in another app (like Terminal) at the same time. However, I should never get this for operations only within SourceTree, whether manual or automatic.

For example, often I'm staging chunks of individual files for a commit. Frequently I'll get an alert that the operation failed and have to try again. Usually, this is because SourceTree is updating something in the background. The app should do some sort of coordination before attempting to modify a working copy, so this error never gets presented to users.
fields.summary: Operations within the app often block each other's access to .git/index.lock

fields.description:
Sorry, this is a dumb thing to file, but the bizarre thumbs up image in the sign in flow is ugly. It was like a poke in the eye in the midst of an otherwise polished looking flow. It's a strange yellow-orange that looks like an emoji fake tan went wrong, there is weird coloring on the knuckles, and the shape is oddly lumpy, unlike a real hand.

Could you just replace it with a nice checkmark in a blue circle? Users need confirmation, not excited approval. (Besides, you've made sign in mandatory, so there's not really a choice at the moment.) Attached a simple possible option from https://www.iconfinder.com/icons/430087/check_checkmark_circle_icon#size=512
fields.summary: Thumbs up image in sign in flow is ugly, use a circled check mark instead

fields.description: I've been slightly annoyed for some time now that "Show Remote Branches" is a popup with 2 items, where one can toggle to "Hide Remote Branches". This is a boolean option, and it should be a checkbox, which would make it that much faster to toggle. (Especially since I can't find any menu item for this, so I can't assign a keyboard shortcut. I'll file a separate bug for that.)
fields.summary: "Show Remote Branches" popup should be a checkbox

fields.description:
One big thing I wish SourceTree did is to display file icons, rather than just SCM status icons. For example, see attached screenshots from Versions and Cornerstone. Seeing the file image is *hugely* useful to me. Like most developers, I work with a wide variety of file types. I need to see whether it's source (.h, .m, .swift), images (.png, .tiff), XML, .plist, .diff, etc.

Reading the filename is way too slow and cumbersome. It always takes me longer than I want to find the files for which I want to stage changes, etc. Please consider this enhancement, it would *really* boost developer productivity.
fields.summary: Display system-provided file icons, not just SCM status icons

fields.description:
The new Branch icon in the toolbar, with the little + and the arc going up to the right, looks strange next to Merge. Maybe it's because the arcs look asymmetric? I liked the old one much better, with the same style now used for the BRANCHES section in the source list.

Clicking on the "Branch" toolbar item displays a sheet which allows both creating and deleting branches. (In fact, the tooltip is "Create or delete branches".) It makes no sense that only + should be represented in the toolbar item. I think you should match the sidebar icon style. Also, in the sheet, the icon for New Branch should be a circle with a + in it, contrasting the circle with - for Delete Branches.
fields.summary: The new "Branch" toolbar icon looks odd, especially since the sheet also allows delete

fields.description: The folder icon that appears in tree view is the style prior to 10.10, and it looks very out of place. It looked bad even in 2.1, when the source list showed the correct default folder icon. You should not even have to ship this image in your app, just use the default icon provided by the OS.
fields.summary: The folder_finderstyle.tiff image is outdated, use default icon provided by OS X

fields.description:
One of my biggest complaints with the 2.2 update is the change to the status icons. In particular, the icons for Modified and Unknown are too close in color. Also, an increased use of letters as opposed to symbols is English-centric and not localization-friendly.

I strongly prefer icons that are more visual, that I can easily disambiguate based on shape and color, rather than having to read a letter to understand the meaning.

In my own app, I've replaced the new icons with icons cribbed from Versions.app, see attached ZIP. Please fix these icons, they're what most users with deal with most frequently, and they need to be as clear as possible.
fields.summary: Status icons regressed in 2.2, are much harder to visually disambiguate now

fields.description:
Frequently, I will pull and/or push changes, either via SourceTree and Terminal, but different parts of the app UI get out of sync.

For example, say I am 3 behind and 1 ahead, then I do `git pull && git push` ini Terminal. The main table will show me up to date, the Pull toolbar item will still have a "3" badge, and the Push toolbar item will still have a "1" badge. It often takes up to a minute for this to update, which is rather annoying. A manual refresh with Command-R often helps, but shouldn't be necessary if the app has already detected a change on disk.
fields.summary: Synchronization issues between toolbar Pull/Push items, source list, and table

fields.description: With the 2.2 update, the height of rows in the source list increased notably. See attached screenshots from 2.1.x and 2.2, showing the same repository. Not how many more stashes used to be visible. These are on a 27" iMac, so it has an even more significant impact on my laptop.
fields.summary: Source list row height is too tall, wastes space

fields.description:
With the 2.2 update, the first thing that confused me was where my local changes were displayed. It took some fiddling to find it inside the WORKSPACE section, which is collapsed by default.

I have no complaint with this placement, it actually makes a lot of sense. However, the section should be expanded by default to make this more discoverable.
fields.summary: Source list should have "WORKSPACE" group expanded by default

fields.description:
The new icon for a branch "folder" in the source list is ugly and barely resembles a folder. It's a very pointy rectangle with a chunk out of it.

It's also kinda unnecessary, since each item that gets a folder icon has a disclosure triangle next to it, and indentation conveys hierarchy. To be honest, I preferred when each branch also had a branch icon next to it, but I can get used to those being gone. Having a folder icon but no branch icon is inconsistent and visually distracting. It causes the name of a branch to start further to the left than the text of the containing folder name. Please either use icons for both, or neither.
fields.summary: Folder icon in source list is ugly, possibly unnecessary

fields.description:
With the 2.2. update, branch names get needlessly truncated when the source list has more than enough space to display names. I have my source list set wider than default, since my project has deeply-nested branch hierarchies (see attached screenshot).

I can work around this by dragging the source list divider to be narrow and then wide again. However, this problem recurs anytime a window is reopened or the app is relaunched.
fields.summary: Source list content width always starts very narrow, needlessly truncates text

fields.description: SourceTree for Mac Version 2.2 (46) can hung after merge on git branches. For me it's occurs very often after update on February 18. Моst of menu items are disabled. Pressing <Cmd>-W <Cmd>-Q produce sound like "Can't be done"
fields.summary: Version 2.2 (46) Hung after merge
Integration with External Merge broken for Kaleidoscope

fields.description:
Prior to today's upgrade, I used to be able to have some idea what branch I was working on or switching to.

Now it's impossible to tell.

Please make the branch name length tied to the width of the sidebar.
fields.summary: Branch names are now unreadable

fields.description:
It would help a lot visually, if local branches that have a corresponding remote branch could be distinguished from local branches that are not available on the remote (anymore).

This would give a better overview in several cases:
* I have created a pull request for my branch, and it was merged by the server (e.g. BitBucket), deleting the original branch from origin. Then I would have a stale local branch that could be deleted. A visual distinction would help to detect those cases.
* When I have a local branch and have forgotten to push it to origin, it would be visually highlighted.
fields.summary: Highlight Branches that Do/Do Not Track a Remote Branch

fields.description:
Hi,

it would be great to have some ability to have all git repositories in one window. Like tabs, or anything. Now I'm almost every day managing 3 git repositories. And more time from time. I love having SourceTree at Mac fullscreen, having all repositories in one window would be nicer, than having so many fullscreen windows.
fields.summary: One window mode

fields.description:
Just installed the new version and opened my main work repository to see this: http://puu.sh/nclT7/56aa06f453.png

All branch names are cut off. Closing and reopening the app doesn't solve the issue. Resizing the pane corrects the problem but it returns once you reopen the app.
fields.summary: Branch folder ellipsis

fields.description: All strings in left sidebar are truncated (see screenshot). To resolve this issue I need to reduce and enlarge the sidebar width. This issue occurs every time I open the window
fields.summary: Ellipsis in sidebar

fields.description: The gitflow button in the main window header bar is no longer available. Even when you go to customise the header bar there is no option to add GitFlow.
fields.summary: GitFlow Button no longer available

fields.description:
After updating to 2.2, when opening SourceTree I am now asked to authenticate with Bitbucket with my username already filled in (and disabled from editing). Upon entering my password the app becomes unresponsive and I am unable to perform any further actions.

The same happens if I click close on the authenticate app and I am only able to close SourceTree by using Force Quit
fields.summary: UI becomes unresponsive after asking for Bitbucket password

fields.description: See attached image - the ellipsis appears at the middle of a large column.
fields.summary: Branch names are truncated although a lot of space remains

fields.description:
I think the problem occurs because of this "feature": "streamlined toolbar"

The truncate of the branch names makes not really sense if you have long branch names with containing f.e. always the same Jira key. Now you can´t see any differences between the branche names!

Can you make this option optional? So a user can deactivate it?
fields.summary: Truncate of branch names
